attributes.action: take urgent action to alleviate the suffering of over one billion people throughout the world suffering from hunger as a result of the global financial crisis.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Prime Minister,

On Friday 19th June 2009 the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) announced that 1.2 billion people (an increase in 100 million) are suffering from hunger due to the global financial crisis.

We the undersigned believe that the UK Government must take urgent action to alleviate the world food crisis through its financial and technical resources. We also ask that the UK Government persuades other nations, through diplomatic channels, to commit resources to alleviating world hunger. 

The UK should particularly use mechanisms within the European Union and the good relations it enjoys with the United States of America to co-ordinate a world wide response to this hunger epidemic.
